subject: Olympic Games (2008)
lead_paragraph: With the Beijing Games only seven months away, the defending Olympic 400 meters champion Jeremy Wariner and his longtime coach have split over a contract dispute. Clyde Hart, who has coached Wariner for five years beginning with their days at Baylor University, said Wariner wanted to pay him less than in his previous contracts. Michael Johnson, the world-record holder in the 200 and Wariner’s agent, did not immediately respond to a telephone message seeking comment left with Wariner’s manager, Deon Minor.
